titleInfo.title: Picnic at the National Home for Jewish Children at Denver

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 5 x 7 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#388 Residents of Nat. Home for Jewish Children'' and ''Jewish Sheltering Home 1910-1950s''. On back of photograph: ''#388 Picnic Supper Out-of-Doors National Home for Jewish Children at Denver 1931 L - Bertha Katzson, rear L-R __ __ __ Doris Greenstein __ Reuben Levine picnic supper out-of-doors ''.

mods.abstract: A group of children sit on an outside deck at the National Home for Jewish Children. Each child has a plate of food and an unidentified woman serves them. Most of the children are unidentified, however, Bertha Katzson, Doris Greenstein and Reuben Levine are part of the group. The children are in the care of the National Home for Jewish Children at Denver in Denver, Colorado. Later, the home became part of the National Jewish Hospital.
mods.note: Donated by the National Asthma Center.

name.namePart: National Home for Jewish Children in Denver
